question: Question 16 Let [latex]A \leq _{m}B[/latex] denotes that language A is mapping reducible (also known as many-to-one reducible) to language B. Which one of the following is FALSE?

options.B: If [latex]A\leq _{m}B[/latex] and A is undecidable then B is undecidable
options.C: If [latex]A\leq _{m}B[/latex] and B is recursively enumerable then A is recursively enumerable.
options.D: If [latex]A\leq _{m}B[/latex] and B is not recursively enumerable then A is not recursively enumerable

Question 26 Consider the store and forward packet switched network given below. Assume that the

into 10 equal parts, and these packets are transmitted from A to B. In the third case, the file is split into 20 equal parts and these packets are sent from A to B. Each packet contains 100
bytes of header information along with the user data. Consider only transmission time and

second and third case respectively. Which one of the following is CORRECT?

encryption is used, with DES as the shared key encryption protocol. Consider the following
four pieces of information: [I1] The URL of the file downloaded by Q [I2] The TCP port numbers at Q and H [I3] The IP addresses of Q and H [I4] The link layer addresses of Q and H Which of I1, I2, I3, and I4 can an intruder learn through sniffing at R2 alone?

question:
Question 28 A graphical HTML browser resident at a network client machine Q accesses a static HTML
webpage from a HTTP server S. The static HTML page has exactly one static embedded
image which is also at S. Assuming no caching, which one of the following is correct about
the HTML webpage loading (including the embedded image)?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A:
Q needs to send at least 2 HTTP requests to S, each necessarily in a separate TCP
connection to server S
options.B: Q needs to send at least 2 HTTP requests to S, but a single TCP connection to server S is sufficient
options.C: A single HTTP request from Q to S is sufficient, and a single TCP connection between Q and S is necessary for this
options.D: A single HTTP request from Q to S is sufficient, and this is possible without any TCP connection between Q and S

solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

question: Question 31 Consider the procedure below for the Producer-Consumer problem which uses semaphores: Which one of the following is TRUE?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: The producer will be able to add an item to the buffer, but the consumer can never consume it.
options.B: The consumer will remove no more than one item from the buffer.
options.C: Deadlock occurs if the consumer succeeds in acquiring semaphore s when the buffer is empty
options.D: The starting value for the semaphore n must be 1 and not 0 for deadlock-free operation.

Question 41 Suppose a stack implementation supports an instruction REVERSE, which reverses the order

following statements is TRUE with respect to this modified stack?

options.A: A queue cannot be implemented using this stack.
options.B:
A queue can be implemented where ENQUEUE takes a single instruction and
DEQUEUE takes a sequence of two instructions.
options.C:
A queue can be implemented where ENQUEUE takes a sequence of three instructions
and DEQUEUE takes a single instruction
options.D:
A queue can be implemented where both ENQUEUE and DEQUEUE take a single
instruction each.

options.B: A smaller block size implies a smaller cache tag and hence lower cache tag overhead
